question.title: Is it possible for ConcurrentHashMap to "deadlock"?

node.contents: Do you have the thread dump?

astNode.text: Do you have the thread dump?

node.contents: There are no other references to the lock object (<0x00002aaaf1207b40>) in the thread dump

astNode.text: There are no other references to the lock object (<0x00002aaaf1207b40>) in the thread dump

node.contents: Is there any other part of the thread dump that shows which thread actually owns the lock? These thread are simply waiting to acquire. Finding out what they are waiting on can help.

astNode.text: Is there any other part of the thread dump that shows which thread actually owns the lock? These thread are simply waiting to acquire. Finding out what they are waiting on can help.

node.contents: We have come across a strange issue with ConcurrentHashMap, where two threads appears to be calling put(), and then waiting forever inside the method Unsafe.park(). From the outside, it looks like a deadlock inside ConcurrentHashMap.

astNode.text: We have come across a strange issue with ConcurrentHashMap, where two threads appears to be calling put(), and then waiting forever inside the method Unsafe.park(). From the outside, it looks like a deadlock inside ConcurrentHashMap.

node.contents: We have only seen this happen once so far.

astNode.text: We have only seen this happen once so far.

node.contents: Can anyone think of anything that could cause these symptoms?

astNode.text: Can anyone think of anything that could cause these symptoms?

node.contents: EDIT: The thread dump for the relevant threads is here:

node.contents: This related bug looks pretty close too: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6822370. We will try upgrading to the latest Java 6 version, as supposedly the latter bug is fixed. Thanks for posting this.

astNode.text: This related bug looks pretty close too: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6822370. We will try upgrading to the latest Java 6 version, as supposedly the latter bug is fixed. Thanks for posting this.

node.contents: Maybe not the answer you want, but this may be a JVM bug. See

astNode.text: Maybe not the answer you want, but this may be a JVM bug. See

node.contents: Package Unsafe is native, an implementation depends on a platform.

astNode.text: Package Unsafe is native, an implementation depends on a platform.

node.contents: Abrupt termination of third thread (on platform level, excepion is not a problem) which acquired a lock on map can cause such situation - state of lock is broken, two other threads are disabled and waiting for someone to call Unsafe.unpark() (And that will never happen).

astNode.text: Abrupt termination of third thread (on platform level, excepion is not a problem) which acquired a lock on map can cause such situation - state of lock is broken, two other threads are disabled and waiting for someone to call Unsafe.unpark() (And that will never happen).
